pr_title: Add partition support for both IamSdkClientFactory.java and IotSdkCli…

timeline.message: add partition supoort for both IamSdkClientFactory.java and IotSdkClientFactory.java

timeline.bodyText: Can we get region from the DeviceConfiguration?
timeline.author: jbutler

replies.bodyText:
I check the usage of both IamClient and IotClient, it was initialized in the GreengrassSetup.java. https://github.com/aws/aws-greengrass-nucleus/blob/master/src/main/java/com/aws/greengrass/easysetup/GreengrassSetup.java#L233
Using awsRegion as String seems more easier and consistent.
replies.author: awszztt

replies.bodyText: getIamClient(String region) is fine. But getIamClient() doesn't work if the GGC is in a non-aws partition. You can either remove it or have it use region from DeviceConfiguration
replies.author: jbutler

timeline.bodyText: This will require us to make a code change every time a region is added. Instead, we can ask the SDK for the partition a region is in, and then map that to a global region (e.g. "aws" -> AWS_GLOBAL, "aws-cn" -> AWS_CN_GLOBAL, etc). That way we only need to update the code to support new partitions.
timeline.author: jbutler
jbutler

timeline.bodyText: Get rid of this map, we don't need to pre-compute these strings.
timeline.author: jbutler

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this is useful
timeline.author: jbutler

timeline.message: check the region partition with the sdk

timeline.author: jbutler
jbutler

timeline.message: remove method of getIamClient without input

timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Sorry, I change this function name back to getGlobalRegion. getPartitionFromRegion is kind of confusing and make us  think it will return the partition name for a given region.
replies.author: awszztt

timeline.bodyText: return Region.of(Region.of(awsRegion).metadata().id()) instead of hardcoding these 3 partitions.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Also, why not use metadata().partition().id() isn't that exactly what we want?
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: The id() is not global region, they are aws-cn, aws-us-gov, aws. I will keep this part.
replies.author: awszztt

replies.bodyText:
Your solution doesn't work.
Region.of("us-east-1").metadata().id() == "us-east-1"
Which is NOT the partition.
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: That should be Region.of(awsRegion).metadata().partition().id(); I did not add the partition(). Sorry about that.
replies.author: awszztt

replies.bodyText:
Region.of(Region.CN_NORTH_1.metadata().partition().id()+"-global") == "aws-cn-global"

Something like this does actually work, although it is a bit hacky with the "-global" it is the only way I have found to do it correctly.
Unless you know better @jbutler
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.message: make changes in the method of getGlobalRegion

timeline.author: MikeDombo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -170,10 +163,10 @@
     protected static final AWSEvergreen greengrassClient = AWSEvergreenClientBuilder.standard()
                                                                              .withEndpointConfiguration(
                                                                                      new AwsClientBuilder.EndpointConfiguration(
-                                                                                             String.format(STAGE_TO_ENDPOINT_FORMAT.get(envStage), GAMMA_REGION.toString()),
+                                                                                             RegionUtils.getEvergreenEndpoint(GAMMA_REGION.toString(), envStage),

replies.author: awszztt

replies.bodyText:
Think of a different name. We cannot use Evergreen. We are Greengrass.
Call it GreengrassHttp vs GreengrassIot endpoint. (the ones with ats are Iot)
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Is that what we're actually doing? I thought we were putting it behind our V1 APIGW and appending v2 to the path.
replies.author: jbutler

replies.bodyText: My confusion. That's still a separate endpoint. +1
replies.author: jbutler

replies.bodyText:
Just check with @ravmenak, the endpoints  containing "evergreen" will be soon replaced by the greengrass.<region>.amazonaws.com/greengrass/v2. (A MCM is starting today to promote this change to the prod).
I will change the method names to getGreengrassHttpEndpoint(without ats) and getGreengrassDataEndpoint(with ats) right now. And make the changes to map of the endpoints when the MCM is done.
replies.author: awszztt

replies.bodyText: greengrass data is confusing, I'd use iot.
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: @MikeDombo in what way is it confusing? IMO using data tells you that it's a dataplane API, and it follows the same convention as IoT. It tells you what the endpoint is for, rather than what the DNS name is. IMO GreengrassIoT doesn't tell you anything - could be control plane or dataplane. Thoughts?
replies.author: jbutler

replies.bodyText: Check the greengrass and iot Core endpoints and quotas https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/greengrass.html and make some changes to the method name accordingly.
replies.author: awszztt
